features: Even Steam Soleplate Design - The advanced soleplate design is engineered to produce consistent steam flow from heel to tip for fast, professional results vs BLACK+DECKER IR08x standard iron with standard soleplate
TrueGlide Nonstick Soleplate - The enhanced nonstick soleplate is engineered to glide smoothly across all types of fabrics
SmartSteam Technology - Take the guesswork out of ironing. SmartSteam automatically optimizes the amount of steam based on the temperature you select
Vertical Steaming - Use the iron as a steamer for quick touch-ups right on the hanger or for steaming curtains and drapes
Automatic Shutoff - For added peace of mind, the iron shuts off when left unattended for 30 seconds on its side or soleplate, and after 8 minutes on the heel rest
body.description: Product Description The BLACK+DECKER Vitessa Advanced Steam Iron with Retractable Cord is streamlining garment care. The TrueGlide nonstick soleplate is engineered with Even Steam technology, which produces more consistent steam flow from heel to tip* for fast, professional results. Our proprietary SmartSteam Technology automatically optimizes steam levels based on the fabric setting you choose using the single control dial. The convenient retractable cord unwinds quickly and retracts with the touch of a button for easy use and storage. Plus, Vitessa delivers powerful bursts of steam to aggressively take out wrinkles, and can even be used vertically to quickly touch-up clothes right on the hanger. This premium performance is exactly what you’d expect from BLACK+DECKER, the number one brand in garment care**. *vs BLACK+DECKER IR08x standard iron with standard soleplate **Source: NPD POS, data as of November 2016. ***When compared to the BLACK+DECKER model F920 iron coating CFT-862B. Brand Story By Black & Decker

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: SmartSteam Technology Take the guesswork out of ironing. SmartSteam automatically optimizes steam levels based on the temperature you select for each type of garment. Stainless Steel Soleplate The durable soleplate glides smoothly across all ironable fabrics. Comfort Grip Handle The ergonomic handle is designed to relieve stress on the hand and wrist for comfortable operation. Anti-Drip The iron is engineered to prevent dripping by closely regulating water temperatures.
Features SmartSteam Technology Stainless Steel Soleplate Automatic Shutoff Anti-Drip Spray Mist Spray Mist The push-button mister helps moisten fabrics to quickly smooth away deep wrinkles.

BLACK+DECKER Light ‘N Easy Compact Steam Iron, IR1020S Ironing is truly a breeze with the BLACK+DECKER Light ‘N Easy Compact Steam Iron. The heavy-duty technology inside this lightweight electric iron removes wrinkles in no time. SmartSteam Technology puts temperature and steam controls in one easy-to-use dial, giving you perfect settings for any type of fabric. Plus, the stainless steel soleplate provides durability and the 3-way auto shutoff delivers peace of mind with every use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's an iron!
reviews.reviewText: It's definitely an iron! I got this for quilting so I can't speak to how it would be for clothes. It seems like a fine basic iron that's budget friendly. For quilting it's been great so far especially for the price. It gets my seams crisp and my fabric wrinkle free. I mainly got it because my favorite color is green and I needed a steam iron. I do really like the retractable cord! I hate having dangling cords everywhere so it's a great feature. I'll warn you that it does retract really fast so don't be silly like me and let it go so fast it flys up and hits you in the face. Ouch! But that's definitely user error not on the iron itself lol.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice and light
reviews.reviewText: Old iron died, this one got good reviews for my search for ‘best simple iron’. Long cord, simple features, works great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a decent iron - it does the job adequately. It's really good at letting off steam, but the tank is a little awkward to fill. There are a lot of temperature options, and you can turn the dial all the way to the right to shut it off. I would say it's a medium weight. I prefer heavier irons because they get out wrinkles better in my opinion. The water spray button was tough at first. When I got the iron, I thought it was broken. But after using both thumbs and pushing HARD several times, it finally started working. Now I can push it with one thumb and normal pressure to get a spray. The cord retraction also isn't the best, but it's not a big deal to me. Finally, note that the inside of the iron is supposed to have condensation when you get it - this means it was tested by the manufacturer before it was shipped. Overall it's not the best iron I've ever used, but it will get out your wrinkles without too much effort.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a great iron. The water tank is large (can take water directly from the tap), it heats up quickly, turns off when "idle" for a few minutes. It's fairly heavy, which is what I wanted-- there is a lightweight version that I haven't tried-- and the dial moves easily and it well placed at the top of the handle. It's not expensive. I had a Black and Decker that suddenly gave out, it's one that is no longer made, and so I tried this one. This is so much better. The water tank is larger, the dial moves much more easily than the previous one, which was quite stiff, and the placement at the top of the handle, instead of awkwardly inside the bottom, the way the other one was. It also gets hotter than the other one-- the previous one I generally used at 6 on cotton, but on this newer model, 5 is plenty and 6 is on the verge of scorching the fabric. Can't recommend it highly enough.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The iron does everything it says it does. Price was affordable and shipping was fast!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars PLenty of steam
reviews.reviewText: This iron has plenty of steam, the retractable cord is a plus, in several surveys it was placed in the top two for steam irons.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars stopped heating after less than 20 uses
reviews.reviewText: i have always liked the black & decker brand, and was so excited when i used this iron for the first time. it was easy to fill, lightweight, & had the right temperatures for the garments i was pressing. i didn't like that the higher temperatures could only be selected with steam, but that was not a huge issue. my satisfaction continued until it stopped heating up 2 weeks after the return window closed. i do not iron every day, & sometimes go a whole week without having to iron anything. maybe if i did iron every day, i would have found out before the return window closed & saved the $3 return charge for the plug. on the upside, though, i will get another iron that works for at least 2 yrs - the length of the warranty. i will update this review, if possible, in a few weeks, after i receive the replacement & have used it at least 20 times. tip: register this iron by calling black & decker 1.800.231.9786, instead of using the unsecure website on the box.update 25 january 2020: i have been using this iron for a while now. overall, it is a fair iron. so, i've upgraded my review from 2 stars to 3 stars.pros: fills easily; lightweight; correct temperature; heats to selected temperature in about a minute; reheats after auto shut-off in a little over 30 seconds. tip: you have to put the iron in the ironing position - soleplate down - to reheat it after auto shut-off.cons: water line is hard to see through the red tint; steam is dramatically reduced when water level is 5/8 or below - it is almost non-existent at that level, but, on the plus side, i use that as an indication that i need to add water, since it's hard to see the water level; intemittent leaking.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Sleek, modern and work well. Great for the price.

My Iron was still running after 20 years, but the electric cord within the unit was loose, making it dangerous. So I was surprised to see all the Irons and prices. This Black & Decker had good reviews, and I must say Irons have advanced. I do not have to use the Steam feature for most of my clothing to get a good press. The sharp point allows me to get into tight places easily. It is also lighter than my previous iron. I do appreciate the upright steam feature as well. The one minus which many mention is it is very difficult to read the amount of water in the tank. The hub of the cord on the bottom was stiff at the beginning making it difficult to lay the iron upright, but it has softened up. All-in-all a good little workhouse for one of our most monotonous but necessary home tasks.

Easy glide, easy temperature selection, good quality. There is nothing that I do not like about this iron. And I have never been a fan of ironing. My mom was the generation that ironed a big pile of clothes on a Sunday night and I have always been very careful in buying clothes that do not require ironing. My husband’s shirts however do need ironing and that was the case when we had a funeral to attend. Our cousin introduced us to her iron and we were sold. Easy glide, easy temperature selection, very good buy for the quality.
It seems to work well. Nice and light. Auto turn off is helpful. Heats up quickly. No complaints

Tiene buen vapor su capacidad de agua es muy buena inconveniente en la mía el botón de golpe de vapor no funciona lamentablemente la use mucho tiempo después de poder hacer el cambio llegó bien empacada me gusta mucho
